column4: Hi guys. trying to install ubuntu server right now, but booting CD gives me this error: gfxboot.c32: not a COM32R image. The cd works in a different machine. any ideas?
Which version of ubuntu server?
latest. 11.10
Try typing "live" at the boot prompt.
Also, is this a literal CD or a USB installer from a Cd image?
its doing *something*...
typing live into boot option seems to just leave it hanging there
OK. And this CD works on another machine?
yes. works on a typical workstation. it is currently failing on a dell server
yea 'live' just makes it hang there with nothing more
Interesting. Only seen that issue on USB sticks, where the "live" or "help" options are a workaround.
any idea where i can go from here to get it working?
I would file a bug report and/or post in the forums. Just to confirm, this is the server installer?
correct
I suppose you could just delete the gfxboot line in isolinux.cfg
it might actually be loading now as i see the logo on screen now
Interesting. What did you change?
Also, did you check the disk for errors?
my cd burning app had checked after writing, but thats all for error checking goes. i presumed that since it works without issue on other machines that wouldnt be a problem
Indeed.
Is sublime in an official repo?
im unsure tbh
I have not heard of it, but am interested in trying it.
A pity. I found it anyway. May give it a go.
